page.title: 08WOKINGHAM _ TRANSPORT
page.content: The{bus service}was started by the Thames Valley Traction Co. Ltd. between l920 and l925. Long before this the{railway}had come to Wokingham when the Wokingham to Guildford line was opened in l849. The{roads}in the area offer access to London and Wales via the M4. The A329(M) connecting Wokingham to the M4 was finished in l973. {Congestion}in the town and at junctions outside is caused by excessive{traffic}to and from Reading, Bracknell and London at rush hour times. {Parking}is also a problem as two supermarkets in the town have a large area of influence. {Trains}run to Waterloo every half an hour with extra services added for the rush hours.{ Buses}still operate locally and coaches run over longer distances, but the{car}is definitely the prime mode of transport.
